info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 14 at 4:24PM EDT until May 14 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... The City of Franklin in southeastern Virginia... Southampton County in southeastern Virginia... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 424 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Boykins, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Newsoms around 445 PM EDT. Courtland around 455 PM EDT. Sedley around 510 PM EDT. Franklin and Hunterdale around 515 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Vicksville, Handsom, Berlin, Manry, Worrell, Dory, Sunbeam, Riverdale, Sebrell and Branchville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
